meanings.definition: To suppose that something is true without having evidence to confirm it.
meanings.sent1: She presumed the package contained her new book.
meanings.sent2: He presumed the store would be closed on Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The cat presumed the empty box was a perfect napping spot.
meanings.sent4: The detective presumed the suspect's innocence until proven guilty.
meanings.sent5: The scientist presumed the theory to be accurate without further testing.

meanings.definition: To take for granted or assume something to be true.
meanings.sent1: They presumed the sun would rise every morning.
meanings.sent2: I presumed you would be at the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The child presumed the cookie jar was always full.
meanings.sent4: The traveler presumed the hotel room would have a view of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The student presumed the answer to be correct without double-checking.

meanings.definition: To believe something to be the case based on probability.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast presumed rain for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: She presumed the train would be delayed due to the storm.
meanings.sent3: The gambler presumed his lucky streak would continue.
meanings.sent4: The farmer presumed a good harvest after a season of heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher presumed most students would pass the exam with proper preparation.
